about_the_game:
This route expands upon the original "TANE" Canadian Rocky Mountains - Columbia River Basin route and updates much of the scenery and utilizes new TRS19 parallax ground textures.

Now with a total of 97 miiles, an additional 34 miles of track has been added to continue your run at high altitude through Kicking Horse Canyon and beyond. Included are sidings at, Glenogle (2.2 miles), Palliser (2.2 miles), Leanchoil (2.2 miles) and finally the Ottertail siding (1.5 miles long).

There's also a new 10 mile track section on the western side to highlight a beautiful location along the Columbia River. Included in the 10 miles west side track is the Beavermouth siding a 2 and 3 Track siding long 2.2 miles.

Sessions:

  • Master all new sidings, switches, signals, slopes and seasons.
  • Drive heavy consist downhill from Ottertail just south of the beautiful (world famous) Yoho National Park.
  • Journey east across the Columbia River starting at Beavermouth.
  • Obey the signals and speed limits and wait for oncoming traffic.

This new route extension comes with similar AI and manual dispatcher sessions that released alongside the original map. These sessions take advantage of the new extended areas of Beavermouth to Ottertail
- Around Golden Junction AI session
- Around Golden Junction Dispatcher session



Purchasing this DLC will see you get the entire Canadian Rocky Mountains - Columbia River Basin route + the Beavermouth to Ottertail extension all combined in the one route as you see in the above map.

View all the details of the original Canadian Rocky Mountains - Columbia River Basin route in the video above.
detailed_description:
This route expands upon the original "TANE" Canadian Rocky Mountains - Columbia River Basin route and updates much of the scenery and utilizes new TRS19 parallax ground textures.

Now with a total of 97 miiles, an additional 34 miles of track has been added to continue your run at high altitude through Kicking Horse Canyon and beyond. Included are sidings at, Glenogle (2.2 miles), Palliser (2.2 miles), Leanchoil (2.2 miles) and finally the Ottertail siding (1.5 miles long).

There's also a new 10 mile track section on the western side to highlight a beautiful location along the Columbia River. Included in the 10 miles west side track is the Beavermouth siding a 2 and 3 Track siding long 2.2 miles.

Sessions:

  • Master all new sidings, switches, signals, slopes and seasons.
  • Drive heavy consist downhill from Ottertail just south of the beautiful (world famous) Yoho National Park.
  • Journey east across the Columbia River starting at Beavermouth.
  • Obey the signals and speed limits and wait for oncoming traffic.

This new route extension comes with similar AI and manual dispatcher sessions that released alongside the original map. These sessions take advantage of the new extended areas of Beavermouth to Ottertail
- Around Golden Junction AI session
- Around Golden Junction Dispatcher session



Purchasing this DLC will see you get the entire Canadian Rocky Mountains - Columbia River Basin route + the Beavermouth to Ottertail extension all combined in the one route as you see in the above map.

View all the details of the original Canadian Rocky Mountains - Columbia River Basin route in the video above.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 10.12
  • Processor: Intel i5 2Ghz
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon Pro 555 with 1GB VRAM supporting OpenGL 3.3
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes

short_description: This route extends the beautiful landscapes of the Rocky Mountains by expanding the original Canadian Rocky Mountains - Columbia River Basin route.
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Russian, Czech, Dutch, Polish, Portuguese - Portugal, Simplified Chinese
